definition: ancient classification system for musical instruments, based on the material of which the instrument is made (metal 金, stone 石, clay 土, leather 革, silk 絲|丝, wood 木, gourd 匏, bamboo 竹)/the eight kinds of sound produced by instruments in these categories/music
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: So the lingbi stone is also called "eight stone".
sentences.chinese: 所以灵璧石又叫“八音石”。

sentences.english: But it was the music box that caught my eye.
sentences.chinese: 可是最吸引我注意的还是那个八音盒。

sentences.english: In The Romaunt of the Rose, he first introduced to the English the octosyllabic couplet.
sentences.chinese: 在《玫瑰传奇》中他首次将八音节对偶句引入英语。

sentences.english: Some conclusions in the study are valuable to designing and manufacturing of the form cavity of the instrument.
sentences.chinese: 文末的若干结论可应用于八音琴形腔的设计与制造。

sentences.english: For example, go back to the Hakka eight tones.
To talk to him was like listening to the tinkling of a worn-out musical-box.
sentences.chinese: 跟他说话，犹如听一架老掉牙的八音盒子丁冬响。

sentences.english: Music box melody is so sad.
sentences.chinese: 八音盒的旋律是如此悲伤。

definition: five notes of pentatonic scale, roughly do, re, mi, sol, la/five classes of initial consonants of Chinese phonetics, namely: 喉音[hou2 yin1], 牙音[ya2 yin1], 舌音[she2 yin1], 齒音|齿音[chi3 yin1], 唇音[chun2 yin1]
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
pre-Tang names of the five notes of the pentatonic scale, corresponding roughly to do, re, mi, sol, la
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
ocarina/wind instrument consisting of an egg-shaped chamber with holes
formal ceremonial music of each succeeding Chinese dynasty starting with the Zhou/Korean a'ak/Japanese gagaku
free reed wind instrument similar to the sheng 笙[sheng1], used in ancient China
